item.title: Instrument Framework v1.14.1.14
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.14.1.14
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 13 Dec 2024 14:55:28 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.14.1]
Major Changes:
- Issue #96: Malleaable VIs Remote Control.vim, Set Config.vim, Get All.vim, and getAll.vim are removed from the package

Other Issues:
- #128: define Help objects in Instrument.Strain
- #129: Instrument.Strain commands moved to private scope
- #130: Instrument method enums moved to private scope. Call protected methods setConfiguration.vi, etc, instead
- #131: "* (This Level).vi" and related calls have been removed. Return your own public API list inside a non-dynamic dispatch VI, if you wish
- #133: Enum to String.vi more robust when supplied command as a variant
- #134: Change Help design pattern following #131 changes
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.14.0.13
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.14.0.13
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 09 Dec 2024 11:22:59 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: **[1.14.0] Release Notes**

This is a major release that introduces breaking changes to existing code. These updates aim to enhance uniformity, performance, and usability.

**Highlights**
- **Subsystem Packaging**:
Core subsystems of the Instrument Framework (e.g., Configuration, RemoteControl, Logger) are now distributed as separate packages.

- **Improved API Uniformity** (Issue #91):
- Enhance external language compatibility (e.g., Python) via unified method names.
- Instrument interfaces classes introduce uniform "abstract" or "interface" methods (e.g., `Instrument.Cryostat.lvclass`) to enforce standardized command formats and parameter data types for child overrides. These are not enforceable by LabVIEW but hoepfully utilizing them will be easier than before.
- `Instrument.LockinAPI.lvclass` is now a fully supported interface class.
- `Instrument.Amplifier.lvclass` is a new interface class (#116).
- `Instrument.SCPI` provides a standardized mechanism for sending and receiving SCPI commands.
- New methods supported by base instrument: `IDN`; `GET` and `SET` methods supported via override (Issue #110).
- Improved documentation and HELP functionality (Issue #105).

**Other Additions and Improvements**
- **New Features**:
- `Instrument.lvlib` introduced for malleable VI organization
- `HAL.lvclass` added as an experimental hardware abstraction layer (Issue #114).
- `API.lvclass` added as an experimental API abstraction layer

- **Usability Enhancements**:
- Debug mode is now attribute-based (Issues #119, #122).
- Flatten/unflatten message data methods unified (Issue #92).
- `Client.vi` added as a new overridable method to manage remote/local client types (Issue #102).
- `sendMessageToProcess` is converted to a polymorphic VI (Issue #124).
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.14.0.12
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.14.0.12
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Thu, 05 Dec 2024 15:40:31 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.14.0]
beta 1-6: This is a major release that will break your existing code, but hopefully will not be too painful to fix.
- Subsystems used by the Instrument Framework are now packaged separately (Configuration, RemoteControl, Logger, etc)
- Issue #91: improved API style and uniformity. The included "abstract" or "interface" methods (ie Instrument.Cryostat.lvclass) do more to enforce a standard command format and params datatype for child overrides. This uniformity will more easily enable calls from external languages (Python, etc)
- Instrument.LockinAPI.lvclass is now a fully-supported Interface class
- Instrument.SCPI iprovides a uniform way to send and receive arbitrary SCPI commands
- Issue #92: Consolidate methods to flatten/unflatten message data
- Issue #95: Time interval for logging instrument status is now an overridable parameter
- Issue #96: Minimize the number of malleable VIs. Save memory and minimize headaches. Local Client.vi and Remote Client.vi are not longer malleable VIs. Rename to RemoteClient and LocalClient

beta 7-8:
- Change handling of logging data

beta 9:
- Add Instrument.lvlib, updated LockinAPI (Issue #100)

beta 10:
- lvlib no bueno for the classes. re-linking hell... try without (keep for enum <> string.vim)

beta 11:
- Issue #96 rename LocalClient --> Local Client and RemoteClient --> Remote Client
- Issue #102: Client.vi is an experimental overridable method with control for Remote/Local client type
- Issue #103: resurrect Instrument.VSource.lvclass and other changes leftover from ca 12/2023
- Add experimental HAL.lvclass
- Issue #105: extended HELP
- Issue #110: GET and SET
- Issue #109: IDN
- Issue #114: HAL (experimental)
- Issue #116: Amplifier Instrument interface
- Issue #119/#122 Debug mode now handled through attributes

beta 12:
- Issue #123: update package dependencies
- Issue #124: convert sendMessageToProcess to polymorphic VI
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

Release Notes: [1.14.0]
beta 1-6: This is a major release that will break your existing code, but hopefully will not be too painful to fix.
- Subsystems used by the Instrument Framework are now packaged separately (Configuration, RemoteControl, Logger, etc)
- Issue #91: improved API style and uniformity. The included "abstract" or "interface" methods (ie Instrument.Cryostat.lvclass) do more to enforce a standard command format and params datatype for child overrides. This uniformity will more easily enable calls from external languages (Python, etc)
- Instrument.LockinAPI.lvclass is now a fully-supported Interface class

- Issue #92: Consolidate methods to flatten/unflatten message data
- Issue #95: Time interval for logging instrument status is now an overridable parameter
- Issue #96: Minimize the number of malleable VIs. Save memory and minimize headaches. Local Client.vi and Remote Client.vi are not longer malleable VIs. Rename to RemoteClient and LocalClient

beta 7-8:
- Change handling of logging data

beta 9:
- Add Instrument.lvlib, updated LockinAPI (Issue #100)

beta 10:
- lvlib no bueno for the classes. re-linking hell... try without (keep for enum <> string.vim)

beta 11:
- Issue #96 rename LocalClient --> Local Client and RemoteClient --> Remote Client
- Issue #102: Client.vi is an experimental overridable method with control for Remote/Local client type
- Issue #103: resurrect Instrument.VSource.lvclass and other changes leftover from ca 12/2023
- Add experimental HAL.lvclass
- Issue #105: extended HELP
- Issue #110: GET and SET
- Issue #109: IDN
- Issue #114: HAL (experimental)
- Issue #116: Amplifier Instrument interface
- Issue #119/#122 Debug mode now handled through attributes

item.title: RemoteControl v1.2.0.7
item.description:
Product: RemoteControl v1.2.0.7
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 27 Nov 2024 14:56:01 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Parent library for sending messages to programs occupying different application instances, ie, LabVIEW running on different computers, multiple instances of LabVIEW on a single computer, or compiled applications. By itself this library does not implement a specific or even working communication protocol, but provides abstract methods that can be overridden by, for example, ZMQ, MQTT, etc.

Release Notes: [1.2.0]
- Issue #120 use debug attribute
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
